name: Multiplexer
description:
A Multiplexer (or MUX) selects one of two inputs (A or B) based on a control input S and forwards it to the output.

This level teaches the basic 2-to-1 multiplexer: when S=0 the output follows A, and when S=1 the output follows B. Multiplexers are used whenever you need to route one of several signals to a single destination â€” for example selecting between different register outputs, choosing between ALU results, or steering input data into a bus.
objectives:
Given inputs A and B and control S, build a circuit so that:
- if S=0 the Output equals A
- if S=1 the Output equals B
hints: S is the selector: use it to choose A or B.
A common construction: (A AND NOT S) OR (B AND S).
You can use NOT, AND and OR to implement that formula.
